oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Phosphorus Fertilizing Effects of Biomass Ashes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schiemenz, Katja
Kern, Jürgen
Paulsen, Hans Marten
Bachmann, Silvia
Eichler-Löbermann, Bettina
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Systems research and participatory research
Soil tillage
Soil
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The reutilization of biomass ashes in agriculture is important to create nutrient cycles. In field and pot experiments we investigated the fertilizing effects of different biomass ashes for eight different crops on a loamy sand and sandy loam. Special emphasis was given to phosphours(P). The ashes showed large differences in their elemental composition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schiemenz, Katja; Kern, Jürgen; Paulsen, Hans Marten; Bachmann, Silvia and Eichler-Löbermann, Bettina (2011) Phosphorus Fertilizing Effects of Biomass Ashes. In: Recycling of Biomass Ashes. Springer, Heidelberg, pp. 17-31.
